articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States abstained on Monday in a United Nations vote on a resolution it drafted to mark the third anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine after the General Assembly agreed to add language supportive of Kyiv to Washington's text.
articles.title: Europeans win in UN clash with US over rival Ukraine resolutions

articles.author: Lili Bayer
articles.description: Israeli Foreign Minister Gideon Saar said on Monday he does not want his country's relationship with Europe to be "held hostage" by views on the conflict with Palestinians, as Israel resumed a dialogue with the European Union strained by the war in Gaza.
articles.title: EU and Israel resume dialogue with focus on Gaza's future

articles.author: Andy Sullivan, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: U.S. government workers who have been buffeted by President Donald Trump's chaotic return to power face more uncertainty on Monday, when many of them will be required to justify their jobs to Elon Musk, the chainsaw-wielding billionaire tasked with slashing the federal budget.
articles.title: Some US government workers told to justify their jobs to Musk, others told to ignore him

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Israeli bulldozers have demolished large areas of the now virtually empty Jenin refugee camp and appear to be carving wide roadways through its once-crowded warren of alleyways, echoing tactics already employed in Gaza as troops prepare for a long-term stay.
articles.title: West Bank Palestinians fear Gaza-style clearance as Israel squeezes Jenin camp

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Olena Harmash
articles.description: Beyond the war of words, U.S. officials opened direct talks with the Russian side in Saudi Arabia last week, shutting out Kyiv and Europe in a stunning change of policy on the war.
articles.title: Ukraine hemmed in as US backing frays three years after Russian invasion

articles.author: Riham Alkousaa
articles.description: Mohammad Azmouz, a Syrian barber living in Berlin, said casting his first ever vote on Sunday at the age of 57 was an indescribable feeling.
articles.title: As Germany moves right, migrants grapple with uncertainty and hope

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Accused Mexican drug kingpin Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada is willing to plead guilty in a deal with prosecutors in the United States if the arrangement spares him from the death penalty, his lawyer told Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: Accused Mexican drug lord 'El Mayo' wants US plea deal without death penalty

articles.author: Enea Lebrun
articles.description: Dozens of Venezuelan migrants boarded small boats on an island off the Caribbean coast of Panama on Monday, setting off towards Colombia by sea as part of a reverse migration of families who have given up trying to reach the United States.
articles.title: Reverse migration: Venezuelans head back toward South America after US dreams dashed

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: A former surgeon accused of raping or sexually assaulting hundreds of young patients, some while they were under anaesthetic, went on trial on Monday in France's largest ever child sexual abuse case.
articles.title: Retired surgeon goes on trial in France's biggest child sex abuse case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's President Vladimir Putin offered the U.S. the opportunity for joint exploration of the country's rare earth metals deposits, as well as the supply of aluminum to the U.S. domestic market, outlining a future economic deal between the two countries.
articles.title: Russia's Putin outlines aluminium, rare earth deals with the US
